front.p: 1867No year is noted, but it must be 1867. March 18: to Grey Auckland Council Libraries GLNZ C28.2 (Grey New Zealand letters)

body.p: The letter accompanying this has been delayed here—nearly a month! For, on my going to the P. Off. in Feby., I casually heard from Mr. Henry Russell & others that you were daily expected here, & at that very time were supposed to be on your way: this is the reason.
Two steamers arriving yesterday from Auckland without you (and two others leaving for Auckland to day)—I now forward it.
Sincerely hoping that your delay in visiting Napier has not been caused by illness.
